comments.content: The right term would be »sign language«. See the list from [Luc Devroye](http://web.archive.org/web/20130226053434/http:/cg.scs.carleton.ca/~luc/sign.html).
ASL. And the proper term is mute.
Unless they are REALLY good at pinball, in which case deaf dumb and blind is appropriate.

It is offensive to my deaf and non-speaking friends and my mother-in-law who taught my son ASL, and all of us, and signed for the deaf for 50+ years would kick some butt! I would hate to go up against her and she is 81.

Got the joke Darrell :-)

Michael
